infotexts.loadingscreentip: You will not get paid for delivering cargo if any of the cargo goes missing or gets damaged during the transport.
Generating more power than the devices in the submarine are consuming may damage junction boxes or cause fires.
Junction boxes and other electrical devices may get damaged if they stay submerged too long.
Letting the submarine's nuclear reactor overheat may cause fires. If an overheated reactor is not shut down, it will eventually lead to a nuclear meltdown.
Most submarines are equipped with stationary batteries that can be used as a temporary source of backup power in the case of a reactor failure.
Railgun shells and depth charges include a compartment that can hold additional explosives.
Passive sonar can be used to detect nearby sound sources without attracting unwanted attention. You can also get a rough idea of your surroundings based on the sounds reflected from the ice walls.
There are many ways to get past locked doors, including forcing them open with a crowbar or rewiring them to a button you have access to.
Stationary batteries are equipped with docks that can be used to charge battery cells.
Oxygen generators are equipped with docks that can be used to refill oxygen tanks.
Supercapacitors can deliver large bursts of power, but cannot store as much energy as batteries. They are often used to power railguns and other devices that require brief bursts of high current.

Nuclear reactors are equipped with an automatic control system that adjusts the power output to a suitable level when enabled. However, the system is not always fast enough to react to large fluctuations in power consumption.
The sonar imaging on the navigation terminal may become inaccurate if the terminal is damaged—make sure your engineers keep the terminal in a good condition!
When deploying a decoy, be sure to deactivate your active sonar for best results.
Attempting to rewire powered devices without adequate electrical engineering skills may get you electrocuted.
Welding tools are simple enough to be used by any submariner, but trained mechanics are generally faster welders and have a lower risk of injuring themselves with the tool.
All submariners have been trained to do basic repairs on electrical devices, but electrical engineers get the job done much faster.
All submariners have been trained to do basic repairs on mechanical devices, but mechanics get the job done much faster.
Captains are generally much more adept at maneuvering the submarine than the average sailor.

If the reactor on a sub is not able to produce sufficient power to run all onboard systems, try reducing the charge rate for the onboard batteries and supercapacitors, or regulate the times when the sub is running at full speed.

The electrical and mechanical systems on a sub will gradually degrade due to the harsh conditions and constant wear and tear. Be sure to have mechanics and engineers perform maintenance from time to time in order to avoid breakdowns at inopportune moments.
Breaking down alien artifacts in a deconstructor may provide you with exotic raw materials.

Some of the alien structures on Europa have been constructed of a metamaterial that's outstandingly resistant to physical damage, and as such has become an important subject of research to Europan scientists.
Special caution must be taken when bringing alien artifacts on board the submarine.

Very little is known of the presumably extinct alien civilization that built the ruins scattered all across Europa. The age of the ruins is also a mystery, since the self-repairing properties of the structures and devices make chronological dating methods wildly inaccurate.

No remains of the alien lifeforms that built the ruins scattered all across Europa have ever been discovered. The only life encountered inside the structures are the biomechanical entities that maintain and guard them.
While exploring ruins or caves, drop flares as often as possible to help mark a path out, should you need to make a hasty exit for some reason.
The cephalopod-like watchers are generally docile, but may attack when provoked.
Cannibalistic behavior is very common among crawlers. Killing one in a swarm may distract the rest as they enter into a feeding frenzy.
Mud raptors can easily tear their way through metal doors with their sharp beaks.
The so-called husk parasites slowly take over and consume the body of their host, eventually turning them into nothing but an empty exoskeleton controlled by the parasite.
Many creatures on Europa are protected by a strong shell, and are difficult to damage with conventional weapons, though there may be weak points in their armor.
Loud devices and sonar pings may alert nearby creatures.
Performing CPR without adequate medical skills may cause internal damage to the patient.
Opiates such as morphine and fentanyl are an effective way of treating injuries in an emergency, but regular use may eventually lead to a state of addiction and cause dangerous withdrawal symptoms.
Bleeding wounds can be treated with bandages and hemostatic agents. The patient may also need saline or blood packs to replace the lost blood.

Mental disorders such as psychosis are unfortunately common among submarine crews, particularly after ruin expeditions. If your crewmates start seeing or hearing things others don't see or hear, report it to a medical doctor immediately.
The medical doctors' main task is to keep the crew in a good shape, but a medic with a syringe gun and a bit of knowhow on poisons can also be very useful in fending off intruders.
Many drugs may have unintended side effects. Keep an eye on the patient and be ready to administer additional medications to counteract these side effects if necessary.
When using a diving mask, be careful not to mix up welding fuel tanks and oxygen tanks.
Diving masks let you breathe underwater, but don't offer any protection against the bone-crushing pressure outside the submarine. If there's a major hull breach, find a diving suit immediately.
In the event of a fire, burns are not the only thing to watch out for—fires can quickly consume all the oxygen inside the submarine.

Traversing the so-called Hydrothermal Wastes requires special caution. Not only are they abundant in wildlife, but the water currents caused by geothermal activity make navigation even more hazardous.
Some of the sessile lifeforms in Europa emit low-frequency sounds that may disrupt the submarine's sonar.
Europa is rich in natural resources, and an enterprising captain with a sharp eye and a plasma cutter may stand to make a tidy profit.
You can disguise yourself as someone else by wearing their ID card and something that covers your face.
It's possible to build voice-controlled systems by linking wifi components to the radio chat in the submarine editor.
The radiation belts around Jupiter make it impracticable to establish permanent settlements above Europa's surface, and as such almost all Europan outposts are located below its icy crust.
The dynamics of Europa's underwater ecosystem are still not fully understood, but it is believed that the base of the food chain is mostly formed by chemosynthetic bacteria.

The Europa Coalition started off as a trade and cooperation agreement between the two largest Europan settlements and a handful of private paramilitary groups, but gradually grew to become what is essentially the Europan government.
The much-ridiculed initiative to help submariners cope in a high-stress environment by including professional entertainers in the crews was promptly deemed a failure and discontinued.

Most vessels avoid venturing outside the tunnels and cracks within Europa's icy crust—the vast, empty Abyss between the surface layers and the rocky interior hosts many of Europa's largest and most dangerous inhabitants.

If left undisturbed for several years, a colony of ballast flora can eventually grow into a Thalamus, an intelligent organism capable of exerting some degree of control over the systems of the submarine it's inhabiting.
You can give context-sensitive commands when the cursor is over a usable object by holding down shift and opening the command interface.

Making trouble at an outpost hurts your reputation. A bad reputation might cause the inhabitants of the outpost to charge you a premium for their services, or, in more extreme cases, lead to a confrontation with their security.

Many Europan outposts don't recognize the Coalition's authority, although it is still powerful enough that few dare to openly oppose it. However, there are groups such as the Jovian Separatists who do fight against it, aiming to bring it down and create a more democratic society.
Behold the Watcher. Don't lose your mind.

Straddling the border between surface ice and the denser, rockier subsurface ice layer, the Europan Ridge is the area along the western-most slope of the Eye of Europa. Warmer water is convected into this area, allowing a wider array of life to subsist.

The Aphotic Plateau sits atop the western rim of an ancient impact crater known as the Eye of Europa. As with the neighboring Europan Ridge, the Plateau’s tunnel networks consist mostly of dark, rocky ice pressed as hard as any stone by the unimaginable weight of the ice above it.

Most of the human habitation on Europa is situated in the so-called Cold Caverns. Due to the cold water and relative proximity to the surface, this biome is biologically less diverse than others, primarily hosting moderate concentrations of crawlers and practically no vegetation.

Ice spires are enormous icy projections that sometimes burst through the subsurface tunnels under Europa's crust. Submarine crews are advised to avoid any contact with the spires, or to destroy any they come across, as the sharp edges can easily tear through a submarine's hull.

The poorly understood "Piezo Crystals" found in The Great Sea pose some extra challenges to crews travelling through the region: Navigating too close to one may cause disruptions in the submarine's electrical grid.
infotexts.pausemenuquitverification: Are you sure you want to return to the main menu? All your unsaved progress will be lost.
infotexts.pausemenuretryverification: Are you sure you want to stop the mission and load the previous save file? All your unsaved progress will be lost.
infotexts.pausemenuquitverificationeditor: Are you sure you want to return to the main menu? All your unsaved progress will be lost.
infotexts.pausemenusaveandquitverification: If you quit now, you will lose the progress you've made during the round, and you'll have to start the mission from the beginning when continuing the campaign. Are you sure you want to quit?
infotexts.serverporttooltip: The port used to communicate with clients. If clients fail to connect to your server, you may need to enable UPnP port forwarding or forward the port manually.
infotexts.serverqueryporttooltip: The port used to communicate with Steam's server browser and respond to info pings from clients. If clients don't see your server in the server list or if authenticating their Steam ID fails, you may need to enable UPnP port forwarding or forward the port manually.
infotexts.publicservertooltip: Public servers are shown in the list of available servers in the 'Server Browser'.
infotexts.attemptupnptooltip: UPnP can be used for forwarding ports on your router to allow players to join the server. However, UPnP isn't supported by all routers, so you may need to setup port forwards manually if players are unable to join the server (see the readme for instructions).
infotexts.gamemodedescription.singleplayercampaign: Embark on a journey through the depths of Europa. Travel from location to location, complete missions to earn money for supplies, discover new biomes…
infotexts.gamemodedescription.sandbox: A game mode with no specific objectives.
infotexts.gamemodedescription.mission: The crew must work together to complete a single mission, such as retrieving an alien artifact or killing a creature that's terrorizing nearby outposts.
infotexts.gamemodedescription.multiplayercampaign: Embark on a journey through the depths of Europa. Travel from location to location, complete missions to earn money for supplies, discover new biomes…
infotexts.gamemodedescription.pvp: The players are split up into two separate subs, tasked with destroying each other.
infotexts.nosubscribedmods: You haven't subscribed to any mods on the Steam Workshop. Select the 'Popular Mods' tab to find some!
infotexts.workshopitemcreatehelptext: You can use this tab to publish new items in the Steam Workshop. You can select a submarine or a content package to publish from the 'Your items' menu at the left.
infotexts.workshopitemcorepackagetooltip: Core packages are special content packages that contain all the core files (executables, configuration files) the game won't run without. There must always be one (and only one) core package selected. Only select this if you wish to create a mod that replaces all the Vanilla files. Mods that only add things to the Vanilla game (or another core package) should not be marked as core packages.
infotexts.workshopitemchangenotetooltip: You're publishing an update for an existing Workshop item. You can use the change note to explain what's new in the update.
infotexts.workshopitemdeletetooltip: Deletes the item from Steam Workshop.
infotexts.workshopitemdeleteverification: Are you sure you want to delete the item '[itemname]' from the Steam Workshop?
infotexts.workshopitempublishtooltip: Uploads the files to the Steam Workshop.
infotexts.workshopitemfileincluded: File will be included in the Workshop item.
infotexts.workshopitemfilenotincluded: File is not present in the Workshop item folder and will not be included in the Workshop item. This may be desirable if you want the mod to use Vanilla files that the players already have—otherwise you should copy the file to the Workshop item folder.
infotexts.workshopitemillegalpath: Workshop items are only allowed to modify files in the Mod folder or add submarine files to the Submarines folder. Please create a separate subfolder for the files.
infotexts.workshopitemrefreshfilelisttooltip: Reload the configuration file of the Workshop item (filelist.xml inside the item's folder) and add all new files in it to the file list.
infotexts.workshopitempublished: [itemname] is now available in the Steam Workshop!
infotexts.workshopitempublishfailed: Publishing '[itemname]' in the Steam Workshop failed.
infotexts.workshopitempreviewimagedialogtitle: Select the preview image for the Steam Workshop item.
infotexts.workshopitempreviewimagetoolarge: The file size of the preview image has to be less than 1 MB.
infotexts.workshoperrorinstallrequiredtoedit: Cannot edit the Workshop item '[itemname]' because it has not been installed.
infotexts.workshoperrorinstallrequiredtoenable: Cannot enable the Workshop item '[itemname]' because it has not been installed.
infotexts.workshoperroroverwriteonenable: Cannot enable Workshop item '[itemname]'. The file '[filename]' would be overwritten by the item.
infotexts.workshoperrorillegalpathonenable: Could not install the file '[filename]'. Workshop items are only allowed to modify files in the Mod folder or add submarine files to the Submarines folder.
infotexts.workshopitemincompatibletooltip: This Workshop item is not compatible with your version of Barotrauma.
infotexts.workshoppublisherror.limitexceeded: Publishing the Workshop item failed (limit exceeded). Make sure you have enabled Steam Cloud and haven't exceeded your Steam Cloud quota. If you are using Steam Cloud sync, having a large number of save files can cause you to run out of space on the cloud. You may want to check [savepath] to make sure you're not storing an excessive number of save files.
infotexts.workshoppublisherror.limiteduseraccount: Publishing the Workshop item failed. Limited user accounts are not allowed to publish items in the Steam Workshop. You need to spend at least $5 in the Steam store to become a non-limited user.
infotexts.workshoppublisherror.banned: Publishing the Workshop item failed because your account has been banned.
infotexts.workshoppublisherror.insufficientprivile: Publishing the Workshop item failed (insufficient privileges). This can happen due to a hub ban, account lock or a community ban. You may need to contact Steam Support.
infotexts.workshoppublisherror.serviceunavailable: Publishing the Workshop item failed (service unavailable). The workshop servers may be having issues. Please try again in a moment.
infotexts.unstableworkshopitempublishwarning: Releasing workshop items with Barotrauma Unstable is not recommended. Features in Unstable are not guaranteed to make it to the public version in the exact same form, and mods developed for Unstable may not work as-is in the public version. Players who are using the normal version of Barotrauma will also not be able to install the item. Are you sure you want to publish the item?
infotexts.workshopitemvisibilitytooltip: Restricts who can see and subscribe to your Workshop item.
infotexts.workshoperrorsamepathinstalled: Could not install '[itemname]' because there is already a mod installed at '[itempath]'.
infotexts.confirmfiledeletion: Are you sure you want to permanently delete "[file]"?
infotexts.modsinstallednotif: Mods installed; open settings to enable
infotexts.workshopitemdownloadprompt: The following Workshop items are required to play on this server: [items] Would you like to subscribe to them?
infotexts.restartrequiredgeneric: You need to restart the game for the changes to take effect.
infotexts.unsavedchangesverification: Are you sure you want to leave without saving the changes made to the settings?
infotexts.corepackagerequiredwarning: You cannot deselect the content package because it is a core package required for the game to work. You may switch it by selecting another core package.
infotexts.cannotremovecontentpackagesub: Cannot remove the submarine file because it's a part of the content package "[contentpackage]". Please uninstall the content package through the Steam Workshop menu.
infotexts.settingresetverification: Are you sure you want to reset the settings?
infotexts.incorrectexe: The executable you have launched is not present in the content package [selectedpackage]. Do you want to launch [exename]?
infotexts.applysettingsquestion: Do you want to apply the settings or discard the changes?
infotexts.restartrequiredresolution: You need to restart the game for the resolution changes to take effect.
infotexts.restartrequiredlanguage: You need to restart the game for the language change to take effect.
infotexts.incompatiblecontentpackage: Content package '[packagename]' is not compatible with this version of Barotrauma. The package was made for the version [packageversion]; your game version is [gameversion].
infotexts.incompatiblecontentpackageunknownversion: Content package '[packagename]' is not compatible with this version of Barotrauma. The package was made for an unknown version; your game version is [gameversion].
infotexts.contentpackagemissingcorefiles: Content package '[packagename]' is marked as a core package but does not contain all the required files for a core package. Missing content file types: [missingfiletypes]
infotexts.contentpackagecantmakecorepackage: Content package '[packagename]' cannot be marked as a core package because it does not contain all the required files for a core package. Missing content file types: [missingfiletypes]
infotexts.pauseonfocuslosttooltip: Pauses the game when its window is not in focus. Note that the game won't be paused when a multiplayer session is active.
infotexts.voipcapturedevicenotfound: Could not start voice capture; suitable capture device not found.
infotexts.contentpackagehaserrors: Errors found in content package '[packagename]'; some of its features may not work correctly.
infotexts.restartrequiredcontentpackage: You need to restart the game for some content package changes to take effect.
infotexts.enablevsynctooltip: Synchronizes the game's frame rate with your monitor's refresh rate. Helps prevent screen tearing artifacts.
infotexts.lightmapscaletooltip: Lower values improve performance, but cause shadows to appear more pixellated.
infotexts.specularlightingtooltip: Enables specular lighting, an effect which creates brighter spots of light on shiny objects.
infotexts.chromaticaberrationtooltip: Enables a subtle color distortion effect at the edges of the screen.
infotexts.enabletexturecompressiontooltip: Significantly reduces the amount of video memory used by textures. This may increase loading times and generate visual artifacts.
infotexts.radialdistortiontooltip: Enables the fisheye screen distortion effect that's caused by certain afflictions and environmental hazards.
infotexts.muteonfocuslosttooltip: Mutes the game when its window is not in focus.
infotexts.localvoicebydefault: Use local voice chat by default
infotexts.localvoicebydefaulttooltip: When enabled, your voice will be sent through the local voice chat (meaning that only nearby players can hear you). You can use the push-to-talk key to speak through the radio.
infotexts.currentdevicetooltip.osx: This device will be used for voice chat. Unfortunately there is no way to change the input device on Mac OS X—it will only use your system's default.
infotexts.refreshdefaultdevicetooltip: Refreshes the input device used for voice chat. If you swap/hotplug the default input on your system then press this to detect that change.
infotexts.voicemode.pushtotalktooltip: Voice activity is sent only when a certain key is held down.
infotexts.voicemode.activitytooltip: Voice activity is sent whenever the sound coming through surpasses the noise gate threshold.
infotexts.directionalvoicechattooltip: When enabled, voice chat messages are panned according to the direction of the speaker relative to your position.
infotexts.dynamicrangecompressiontooltip: Adjusts the game's volume automatically to prevent audio distortion.
infotexts.voipattenuationtooltip: Lowers the game's volume when players are speaking.
infotexts.cutoffpreventiontooltip: Continues voice transmission for a certain amount of time after the push-to-talk key has been released or the voice activity goes under the threshold.
infotexts.aimassisttooltip: Affects how close the cursor has to be to an item to highlight it. If set to 0%, the cursor has to be exactly on the item.
infotexts.enablemouselooktooltip: When enabled, the camera moves according to the direction you point the cursor to.
infotexts.setdefaultbindingstooltip: Set key bindings to the recommended default settings (left mouse button to select items, right mouse button or esc to deselect).
infotexts.setlegacybindingstooltip: Set key bindings to ones that were used in the old pre-alpha versions of Barotrauma (E to select and deselect items, left mouse button to use item the in hand).
infotexts.serversettingsminrespawntooltip: What percentage of players has to be dead/spectating until a respawn shuttle is dispatched.
infotexts.serversettingsrespawndurationtooltip: The amount of time respawned players have to navigate the respawn shuttle to the main submarine. After the duration expires, the shuttle will automatically head back out of the level.
infotexts.serversettingsusetraitorratio: Use % of players for max traitors
infotexts.serversettingstraitorsminplayercounttool: How many players need to join the server before traitors can appear.
infotexts.serverrestartrequiredcontentpackage: Before hosting a server, you need to restart the game for the content package changes to take effect.
infotexts.tabmenu.characterchangespending: Changes to your character will be applied after the current round ends.
infotexts.roundsummarygameover: The ocean has claimed [sub] and its crew.

infotexts.disconnectedturretswarning: The submarine contains [itemname]s which haven't been linked to an ammunition loader. Select the item and click a loader while holding space to link them.
infotexts.nowaypointswarning: No waypoints found in the submarine. AI controlled crew members won't be able to navigate without waypoints.
infotexts.nocargospawnpointwarning: The submarine does not have spawnpoints for cargo (which are used for determining where to place bought items). To fix this, create a new spawnpoint and change its spawn type' parameter to 'cargo'.
infotexts.farawayentitieswarning: One or more structures/items have been placed very far from the submarine. Do you want to move the camera to them?
infotexts.adjustlightsprompt: This submarine was saved using an older version of Barotrauma, which used a different formula to calculate lighting. The lighting in the submarine may now appear too bright. Do you want to automatically readjust the lighting for the new lighting formula?
infotexts.adjustedlightsnotification: The brightness of the lights has been adjusted. Areas with multiple light sources may still appear too bright and require reducing the range or brightness of the lights manually. You may also use the console command 'multiplylights' to adjust the brightness of all the lights as once. For example, 'multiplylights 1,1,1,0.5' would decrease the brightness by 50%.
infotexts.noballasttagswarning: You should add the tag 'ballast' to the ballast pumps to allow AI characters to identify which pumps are used for controlling the buoyancy of the submarine.
infotexts.insufficientfreeconnectionswarning: The module contains a junction box that's been linked to [doorcount] doors but only has [freeconnectioncount] free wire connections available. This may prevent the outpost from being powered properly.
infotexts.nohullnameswarning: No names given to any of the hulls, using autogenerated names. Characters use the names to refer to different rooms when reporting things such as hull breaches.
infotexts.deletingcontainerwithitems:
A container with items inside was deleted, delete contained items as well?

Contained items:
infotexts.mirrorentityxtooltip: Mirror the entity horizontally. You can also use the shortcut Ctrl + N.
infotexts.mirrorentityytooltip: Mirror the entity horizontally. You can also use the shortcut Ctrl + M.
infotexts.nonlinkedgapswarning: The submarine contains gaps that aren't linked to any hulls. Gaps should always overlap with at least one hull (= a gap that leads outside the sub) or two hulls if it's a gap between rooms.
infotexts.cannoteditvanillasubs: Cannot edit the submarines defined in the Vanilla content package!
infotexts.stringpropertytranslate: This text will be translated to [translation].
infotexts.stringpropertycannottranslate: This text will not be translated - text with the tag [tag] not found in the language files.
infotexts.charactereditor.contentpackagenameinuse: A content package with the same name already exists. Please choose another name or select the existing content package from the dropdown if you want to add the character to it.
infotexts.eventeditor.newprojectprompt: Are you sure you want to create a new project? All unsaved changes will be lost.
infotexts.eventeditor.opentextbody: Do you want to open the exported event in a text editor?
infotexts.eventeditor.randomgenerationbody: This event was not created with the event editor and does not have node positions defined so they have been automatically generated.
infotexts.sp.emitter.anglerange.name: Angle Range
infotexts.sp.emitter.velocityrange.name: Velocity Range
infotexts.sp.emitter.scalerange.name: Scale Range
infotexts.sp.emitter.particleburstamount.name: Particle Burst Amount
infotexts.sp.emitter.particleburstinterval.name: Particle Burst Interval
infotexts.sp.emitter.particlespersecond.name: Particles Per Second
infotexts.sp.lightsourceparams.color.name: Color
infotexts.sp.lightsourceparams.range.name: Range
infotexts.sp.levelgenerationparams.wallcolor.name: Wall Color
infotexts.sp.levelgenerationparams.levelobjectamou: The total number of level objects (vegetation, vents, etc) in the level.
infotexts.sp.levelgenerationparams.minwidth.name: Min Width
infotexts.sp.levelgenerationparams.maxwidth.name: Max Width
infotexts.sp.levelgenerationparams.height.name: Height
infotexts.sp.levelgenerationparams.voronoisiteinte: How far from each other voronoi sites are placed. Sites determine shape of the voronoi graph which the level walls are generated from. (Decreasing this value causes the number of sites, and the complexity of the level, to increase exponentially - be careful when adjusting)
infotexts.sp.levelgenerationparams.voronoisitevari: How much random variation to apply to the positions of the voronoi sites on each axis. Small values produce roughly rectangular level walls. The larger the values are, the less uniform the shapes get.
infotexts.sp.levelgenerationparams.cellsubdivision: The edges of the individual wall cells are subdivided into edges of this size. Can be used in conjunction with the rounding values to make the cells rounder. Smaller values will make the cells look smoother, but make the level more performance-intensive as the number of polygons used in rendering and physics calculations increases.
infotexts.sp.levelgenerationparams.cellroundingamo: How much the individual wall cells are rounded. Note that the final shape of the cells is also affected by the CellSubdivisionLength parameter.
infotexts.sp.levelgenerationparams.cellirregularit: How much random variance is applied to the edges of the cells. Note that the final shape of the cells is also affected by the CellSubdivisionLength parameter.
infotexts.sp.levelgenerationparams.mainpathnodeint: The distance between the nodes that are used to generate the main path through the level (min, max). Larger values produce a straighter path.
infotexts.sp.levelgenerationparams.smalltunnelcoun: The number of small tunnels placed along the main path.
infotexts.sp.levelgenerationparams.smalltunnelleng: The minimum and maximum length of small tunnels placed along the main path.
infotexts.sp.levelgenerationparams.itemcount.name: Item Count
infotexts.sp.levelgenerationparams.seafloordepth.d: How far below the level the sea floor is placed.
infotexts.sp.levelgenerationparams.seafloorvarianc: Variance of the depth of the sea floor. Smaller values produce a smoother sea floor.
infotexts.sp.levelgenerationparams.mountaincountmi: The minimum number of mountains on the sea floor.
infotexts.sp.levelgenerationparams.mountaincountma: The maximum number of mountains on the sea floor.
infotexts.sp.levelgenerationparams.mountainheightm: The minimum height of the mountains on the sea floor.
The maximum height of the mountains on the sea floor.
infotexts.sp.levelgenerationparams.ruincount.name: Ruin Count
infotexts.sp.levelgenerationparams.ruincount.descr: The number of alien ruins in the level.
infotexts.sp.levelgenerationparams.bottomholeproba: The probability for wall cells to be removed from the bottom of the map. A value of 0 will produce a completely enclosed tunnel and 1 will make the entire bottom of the level completely open.
infotexts.sp.levelgenerationparams.waterparticlesc: Scale of the water particle texture.
infotexts.sp.levelobjectprefab.minsize.name: Min Size
infotexts.sp.levelobjectprefab.maxsize.name: Max Size
infotexts.sp.levelobjectprefab.alignment.name: Alignment
infotexts.sp.levelobjectprefab.alignment.descripti: Which sides of a wall the object can spawn on.
infotexts.sp.levelobjectprefab.spawnpos.name: Spawn Pos
infotexts.sp.levelobjectprefab.depthrange.name: Depth Range
infotexts.sp.levelobjectprefab.clusteringamount.de: The tendency for the prefab to form clusters. Used as an exponent for perlin noise values that are used to determine the probability for an object to spawn at a specific position.
infotexts.sp.levelobjectprefab.clusteringgroup.des: A value between 0-1 that determines the z-coordinate to sample perlin noise from when determining the probability for an object to spawn at a specific position. Using the same (or close) value for different objects means the objects tend to form clusters in the same areas.
infotexts.sp.levelobjectprefab.alignwithsurface.de: Should the object be rotated to align it with the wall surface it spawns on.
infotexts.sp.levelobjectprefab.minsurfacewidth.des: Minimum length of a graph edge the object can spawn on.
infotexts.sp.levelobjectprefab.randomrotation.name: Random Rotation
infotexts.sp.levelobjectprefab.randomrotation.desc: How much the rotation of the object can vary (min and max values in degrees).
infotexts.sp.levelobjectprefab.swingamount.name: Swing Amount
infotexts.sp.levelobjectprefab.swingamount.descrip: How much the object swings (in degrees).
infotexts.sp.levelobjectprefab.swingfrequency.name: Swing Frequency
infotexts.sp.levelobjectprefab.scaleoscillation.de: How much the scale of the object oscillates on each axis. A value of 0.5,0.5 would make the object's scale oscillate from 100% to 150%.
infotexts.sp.levelobjectprefab.scaleoscillationfre: How fast the object's scale oscillates.
infotexts.sp.levelobjectprefab.commonness.name: Commonness
infotexts.sp.levelobjectprefab.commonness.descript: How likely it is for the object to spawn in a level. This is relative to the commonness of the other objects - for example, having an object with a commonness of 1 and another with a commonness of 10 would mean the latter appears in levels 10 times as frequently as the former. The commonness value can be overridden on specific level types.
infotexts.sp.levelobjectprefab.sonardisruption.des: How much the object disrupts submarine's sonar.
infotexts.sp.noisedeformationparams.frequency.name: Frequency
infotexts.sp.noisedeformationparams.amplitude.name: Amplitude
infotexts.sp.noisedeformationparams.amplitude.desc: How much the noise distorts the sprite.
infotexts.sp.noisedeformationparams.sync.name: Sync
infotexts.sp.noisedeformationparams.blendmode.name: Blend Mode
infotexts.sp.noisedeformationparams.strength.name: Strength
infotexts.sp.customdeformationparams.frequency.des: How fast the deformation oscillates back and forth. For example, if the sprite is stretched up, setting this value above zero would make it do a wave-like movement up and down.
infotexts.sp.customdeformationparams.sync.name: Sync
infotexts.sp.customdeformationparams.strength.name: Strength
infotexts.sp.inflateparams.frequency.name: Frequency
infotexts.sp.inflateparams.scale.name: Scale
infotexts.sp.inflateparams.sync.name: Sync
infotexts.sp.inflateparams.blendmode.name: Blend Mode
infotexts.sp.inflateparams.strength.name: Strength
infotexts.sp.inflateparams.maxrotation.name: Max Rotation
infotexts.sp.inflateparams.usemovementsine.name: Use Movement Sine
infotexts.sp.inflateparams.stopwhenhostisdead.name: Stop When Host Is Dead
infotexts.sp.inflateparams.sineoffset.name: Sine Offset
infotexts.sp.item.hiddeningame.name: Hidden In Game
infotexts.sp.item.noninteractable.name: Non Interactable
infotexts.sp.item.scale.name: Scale
infotexts.sp.item.spritecolor.name: Sprite Color
infotexts.sp.item.inventoryiconcolor.name: Inventory Icon Color
infotexts.sp.item.containercolor.name: Container Color
infotexts.sp.item.containercolor.description: Changes the color of the item this item is contained inside. Only has an effect if either of the UseContainedSpriteColor or UseContainedInventoryIconColor property of the container is set to true.
infotexts.sp.item.condition.name: Condition
infotexts.sp.item.tags.name: Tags
infotexts.sp.item.displaysidebysidewhenlinked.name: Display Side By Side When Linked
infotexts.sp.item.displaysidebysidewhenlinked.desc: Enable if you want to display the item HUD side by side with another item's HUD, when linked together. Disclaimer: It's possible or even likely that the views block each other, if they were not designed to be viewed together!
infotexts.sp.item.spritedepth.name: Sprite Depth
infotexts.sp.itemcontainer.itempos.name: Item Pos
infotexts.sp.itemcontainer.itempos.description: The position where the contained items get drawn at (offset from the upper left corner of the sprite in pixels).
infotexts.sp.itemcontainer.iteminterval.name: Item Interval
infotexts.sp.itemcontainer.iteminterval.descriptio: The interval at which the contained items are spaced apart from each other (in pixels).
infotexts.sp.itemcontainer.containablerestrictions: Define items (by identifiers or tags) that bots should place inside this container. If empty, no restrictions are applied.
infotexts.sp.controller.istoggle.name: Is Toggle
infotexts.sp.controller.istoggle.description: When enabled, the item will continuously send out a 0/1 signal and interacting with it will flip the signal (making the item behave like a switch). When disabled, the item will simply send out 1 when interacted with.
infotexts.sp.controller.state.name: State
infotexts.sp.controller.state.description: Whether the item is toggled on/off. Only valid if IsToggle is set to true.
infotexts.sp.connectionpanel.locked.name: Locked
infotexts.sp.connectionpanel.locked.description: Locked connection panels cannot be rewired in-game.
infotexts.sp.holdable.holdpos.name: Hold Pos
infotexts.sp.holdable.holdpos.description: The position the character holds the item at (in pixels, as an offset from the character's shoulder). For example, a value of 10,-100 would make the character hold the item 100 pixels below the shoulder and 10 pixels forwards.
infotexts.sp.holdable.holdangle.name: Hold Angle
infotexts.sp.holdable.holdangle.description: The rotation at which the character holds the item (in degrees, relative to the rotation of the character's hand).
infotexts.sp.holdable.swingamount.name: Swing Amount
infotexts.sp.holdable.swingamount.description: How much the item swings around when aiming/holding it (in pixels, as an offset from AimPos/HoldPos).
infotexts.sp.holdable.swingspeed.name: Swing Speed
infotexts.sp.holdable.swingspeed.description: How fast the item swings around when aiming/holding it (only valid if SwingAmount is set).
infotexts.sp.holdable.swingwhenholding.name: Swing When Holding
infotexts.sp.holdable.swingwhenholding.description: Should the item swing around when it's being held.
infotexts.sp.holdable.swingwhenaiming.name: Swing When Aiming
infotexts.sp.holdable.swingwhenaiming.description: Should the item swing around when it's being aimed.
infotexts.sp.holdable.swingwhenusing.name: Swing When Using
infotexts.sp.holdable.swingwhenusing.description: Should the item swing around when it's being used (for example, when firing a weapon or a welding tool).
infotexts.sp.door.openingspeed.name: Opening Speed
infotexts.sp.door.closingspeed.name: Closing Speed
infotexts.sp.door.isopen.name: Is Open
infotexts.sp.repairable.deteriorationspeed.name: Deterioration Speed
infotexts.sp.repairable.deteriorationspeed.descrip: How fast the condition of the item deteriorates per second.
infotexts.sp.repairable.mindeteriorationdelay.name: Min Deterioration Delay
infotexts.sp.repairable.mindeteriorationdelay.desc: Minimum initial delay before the item starts to deteriorate.
infotexts.sp.repairable.maxdeteriorationdelay.name: Max Deterioration Delay
infotexts.sp.repairable.maxdeteriorationdelay.desc: Maximum initial delay before the item starts to deteriorate.
The item won't deteriorate spontaneously if the condition is below this value. For example, if set to 10, the condition will spontaneously drop to 10 and then stop dropping (unless the item is damaged further by external factors). Percentages of max condition.
infotexts.sp.repairable.showrepairuithreshold.name: Show Repair U I Threshold
infotexts.sp.repairable.showrepairuithreshold.desc: The condition of the item has to be below this before the repair UI becomes usable. Percentages of max condition.
infotexts.sp.repairable.fixdurationlowskill.name: Fix Duration Low Skill
infotexts.sp.repairable.fixdurationlowskill.descri: The amount of time it takes to fix the item with insufficient skill levels.
infotexts.sp.repairable.fixdurationhighskill.name: Fix Duration High Skill
infotexts.sp.repairable.fixdurationhighskill.descr: The amount of time it takes to fix the item with sufficient skill levels.
infotexts.sp.structure.specialtag.name: Special Tag
infotexts.sp.structure.spritecolor.name: Sprite Color
infotexts.sp.structure.usedropshadow.name: Use Drop Shadow
infotexts.sp.structure.dropshadowoffset.name: Drop Shadow Offset
infotexts.sp.structure.dropshadowoffset.descriptio: The position of the drop shadow relative to the structure. If set to zero, the shadow is positioned automatically so that it points towards the sub's center of mass.
infotexts.sp.structure.scale.name: Scale
infotexts.sp.structure.texturescale.name: Texture Scale
infotexts.sp.structure.textureoffset.name: Texture Offset
infotexts.sp.structure.spritedepth.name: Sprite Depth
infotexts.sp.structure.removeiflinkedoutpostdoorin: Remove if linked outpost door is in use

If the structure is linked to a door at the edge of an outpost module, this setting will cause the structure to be removed if the door gets used in the outpost. Otherwise the structure is removed if the door is NOT used.
infotexts.sp.lightcomponent.range.name: Range
infotexts.sp.lightcomponent.range.description: The range of the emitted light. Higher values are more performance-intensive.
infotexts.sp.lightcomponent.castshadows.name: Cast Shadows
infotexts.sp.lightcomponent.castshadows.descriptio: Should structures cast shadows when light from this light source hits them. Disabling shadows increases the performance of the game, and is recommended for lights with a short range.
infotexts.sp.lightcomponent.drawbehindsubs.name: Draw Behind Subs
infotexts.sp.lightcomponent.drawbehindsubs.descrip: Lights drawn behind submarines don't cast any shadows and are much faster to draw than shadow-casting lights. It's recommended to enable this on decorative lights outside the submarine's hull.
infotexts.sp.lightcomponent.ison.name: Is On
infotexts.sp.lightcomponent.blinkfrequency.name: Blink Frequency
infotexts.sp.lightcomponent.blinkfrequency.descrip: How rapidly the light blinks on and off (in Hz). 0 = no blinking.
infotexts.sp.steering.neutralballastlevel.name: Neutral Ballast Level
infotexts.sp.steering.neutralballastlevel.descript: How full the ballast tanks should be when the submarine is not being steered upwards/downwards. Can be used to compensate if the ballast tanks are too large/small relative to the size of the submarine.
infotexts.sp.sonar.usetransducers.name: Use Transducers
infotexts.sp.sonar.usetransducers.description: Does the sonar have to be connected to external transducers to work.
infotexts.sp.itemlabel.text.name: Text
infotexts.sp.itemlabel.text.description: The text displayed in the label.
infotexts.sp.itemlabel.textcolor.name: Text Color
infotexts.sp.itemlabel.textcolor.description: The color of the text displayed on the label (R,G,B,A).
infotexts.sp.itemlabel.textscale.name: Text Scale
infotexts.sp.itemlabel.textscale.description: The scale of the text displayed on the label.
infotexts.sp.minimap.requirewaterdetectors.name: Require Water Detectors
infotexts.sp.minimap.requirewaterdetectors.descrip: Does the machine require inputs from water detectors in order to show the water levels inside rooms.
infotexts.sp.minimap.requireoxygendetectors.name: Require Oxygen Detectors
infotexts.sp.minimap.requireoxygendetectors.descri: Does the machine require inputs from oxygen detectors in order to show the oxygen levels inside rooms.
infotexts.sp.minimap.showhullintegrity.name: Show Hull Integrity
infotexts.sp.minimap.showhullintegrity.description: Should damaged walls be displayed by the machine.
infotexts.sp.reactor.maxpoweroutput.name: Max Power Output
infotexts.sp.reactor.maxpoweroutput.description: How much power (kW) the reactor generates when operating at full capacity.
infotexts.sp.reactor.meltdowndelay.name: Meltdown Delay
infotexts.sp.reactor.meltdowndelay.description: How long the temperature has to stay critical until a meltdown occurs.
infotexts.sp.reactor.firedelay.name: Fire Delay
infotexts.sp.reactor.firedelay.description: How long the temperature has to stay critical until the reactor catches fire.
infotexts.sp.reactor.fuelconsumptionrate.name: Fuel Consumption Rate
infotexts.sp.reactor.fuelconsumptionrate.descripti: How fast the condition of the contained fuel rods deteriorates per second.
infotexts.sp.powercontainer.maxoutput.name: Max Out Put
infotexts.sp.powercontainer.maxoutput.description: Maximum output of the device when fully charged (kW).
infotexts.sp.powercontainer.capacity.name: Capacity
infotexts.sp.powercontainer.capacity.description: The maximum capacity of the device (kW * min). For example, a value of 1000 means the device can output 100 kilowatts of power for 10 minutes, or 1000 kilowatts for 1 minute.
infotexts.sp.powercontainer.charge.name: Charge
infotexts.sp.powercontainer.charge.description: The current charge of the device.
infotexts.sp.powercontainer.maxrechargespeed.name: Max Recharge Speed
infotexts.sp.powercontainer.maxrechargespeed.descr: How fast the device can be recharged. For example, a recharge speed of 100 kW and a capacity of 1000 kW*min would mean it takes 10 minutes to fully charge the device.
infotexts.sp.powercontainer.rechargespeed.name: Recharge Speed
infotexts.sp.powercontainer.rechargespeed.descript: The current recharge speed of the device.
infotexts.sp.oxygengenerator.generatedamount.name: Generated Amount
infotexts.sp.oxygengenerator.generatedamount.descr: How much oxygen the machine generates when operating at full power.
infotexts.sp.engine.maxforce.name: Max Force
infotexts.sp.engine.maxforce.description: The amount of force exerted on the submarine when the engine is operating at full power.
infotexts.sp.engine.propellerpos.name: Propeller Pos
infotexts.sp.engine.propellerpos.description: The position of the propeller as an offset from the item's center (in pixels). Determines where the particles spawn and the position that causes characters to take damage from the engine if the PropellerDamage is defined.
infotexts.sp.particleprefab.lifetime.name: Life Time
infotexts.sp.particleprefab.lifetime.description: How many seconds the particle remains alive.
infotexts.sp.particleprefab.startdelaymin.name: Start Delay Min
infotexts.sp.particleprefab.startdelaymin.descript: How long it takes for the particle to appear after spawning it.
infotexts.sp.particleprefab.startdelaymax.name: Start Delay Max
infotexts.sp.particleprefab.startdelaymax.descript: How long it takes for the particle to appear after spawning it.
infotexts.sp.particleprefab.startrotationmin.name: Start Rotation Min
infotexts.sp.particleprefab.startrotationmin.descr: The minimum initial rotation of the particle (in degrees).
infotexts.sp.particleprefab.startrotationmax.name: Start Rotation Max
infotexts.sp.particleprefab.startrotationmax.descr: The maximum initial rotation of the particle (in degrees).
infotexts.sp.particleprefab.rotatetodirection.name: Rotate To Direction
infotexts.sp.particleprefab.rotatetodirection.desc: Should the particle face the direction it's moving towards.
infotexts.sp.particleprefab.drag.name: Drag
infotexts.sp.particleprefab.drag.description: Drag applied to the particle when it's moving through air.
infotexts.sp.particleprefab.waterdrag.name: Water Drag
infotexts.sp.particleprefab.waterdrag.description: Drag applied to the particle when it's moving through water.
infotexts.sp.particleprefab.velocitychange.name: Velocity Change
infotexts.sp.particleprefab.velocitychange.descrip: How much the velocity of the particle changes per second.
infotexts.sp.particleprefab.velocitychangewater.de: How much the velocity of the particle changes per second when in water.
infotexts.sp.particleprefab.collisionradius.name: Collision Radius
infotexts.sp.particleprefab.usecollision.name: Use Collision
infotexts.sp.particleprefab.usecollision.descripti: Does the particle collide with the walls of the submarine and the level.
infotexts.sp.particleprefab.deleteoncollision.name: Delete On Collision
infotexts.sp.particleprefab.deleteoncollision.desc: Does the particle disappear when it collides with something.
infotexts.sp.particleprefab.friction.name: Friction
infotexts.sp.particleprefab.friction.description: The friction coefficient of the particle, i.e. how much it slows down when it's sliding against a surface.
infotexts.sp.particleprefab.restitution.name: Restitution
infotexts.sp.particleprefab.restitution.descriptio: How much of the particle's velocity is conserved when it collides with something, i.e. the bounciness of the particle. (1.0 = the particle stops completely).
infotexts.sp.particleprefab.startsizemin.name: Start Size Min
infotexts.sp.particleprefab.startsizemin.descripti: The minimum initial size of the particle.
infotexts.sp.particleprefab.startsizemax.name: Start Size Max
infotexts.sp.particleprefab.startsizemax.descripti: The maximum initial size of the particle.
infotexts.sp.particleprefab.sizechangemin.name: Size Change Min
infotexts.sp.particleprefab.sizechangemin.descript: How much the size of the particle changes per second. The rate of growth for each particle is randomize between SizeChangeMin and SizeChangeMax.
infotexts.sp.particleprefab.sizechangemax.name: Size Change Max
infotexts.sp.particleprefab.sizechangemax.descript: How much the size of the particle changes per second. The rate of growth for each particle is randomize between SizeChangeMin and SizeChangeMax.
infotexts.sp.particleprefab.growtime.name: Grow Time
infotexts.sp.particleprefab.growtime.description: How many seconds it takes for the particle to grow to it's initial size.
infotexts.sp.particleprefab.startcolor.name: Start Color
infotexts.sp.particleprefab.startcolor.description: The initial color of the particle.
infotexts.sp.particleprefab.endcolor.name: End Color
infotexts.sp.particleprefab.endcolor.description: The color of the particle at the end of its lifetime.
infotexts.sp.particleprefab.drawtarget.name: Draw Target
infotexts.sp.particleprefab.drawtarget.description: Should the particle be rendered in air, water or both.
infotexts.sp.particleprefab.blendstate.name: Blend State
infotexts.sp.particleprefab.blendstate.description: The type of blending to use when rendering the particle.
infotexts.sp.particleprefab.animduration.name: Anim Duration
infotexts.sp.particleprefab.animduration.descripti: The duration of the particle's animation cycle (if it's animated).
infotexts.sp.particleprefab.loopanim.name: Loop Anim
infotexts.sp.particleprefab.loopanim.description: Should the sprite animation be looped, or stay at the last frame when the animation finishes.
infotexts.sp.hull.roomname.name: Room Name
infotexts.sp.hull.spritedepth.name: Sprite Depth
infotexts.sp.hull.scale.name: Scale
infotexts.sp.delaycomponent.delay.name: Delay
infotexts.sp.delaycomponent.delay.description: How long the item delays the signals (in seconds).
infotexts.sp.delaycomponent.resetwhensignalreceive: Should the component discard previously received signals when a new one is received.
infotexts.sp.delaycomponent.resetwhendifferentsign: Should the component discard previously received signals when the incoming signal changes.
infotexts.sp.andcomponent.timeframe.name: Time Frame
infotexts.sp.andcomponent.timeframe.description: The item sends the output if both inputs have received a non-zero signal within the timeframe. If set to 0, the inputs must receive a signal at the same time.
infotexts.sp.andcomponent.output.name: Output
infotexts.sp.andcomponent.output.description: The signal sent when both inputs have received a non-zero signal.
infotexts.sp.andcomponent.falseoutput.name: False Output
infotexts.sp.andcomponent.falseoutput.description: The signal sent when both inputs have not received a non-zero signal (if empty, no signal is sent).
infotexts.sp.orcomponent.timeframe.description: The item sends the output if either of the inputs has received a non-zero signal within the timeframe. If set to 0, the inputs must receive a signal at the same time.
infotexts.sp.orcomponent.output.description: The signal sent when either of the inputs has received a non-zero signal.
infotexts.sp.orcomponent.falseoutput.description: The signal sent when none of the inputs have received a non-zero signal (if empty, no signal is sent).
infotexts.sp.orcomponent.timeframe.description: The item sends the output if either of the inputs has received a non-zero signal within the timeframe.
infotexts.sp.orcomponent.output.description: The signal sent when either of the inputs has received a non-zero signal.
infotexts.sp.orcomponent.falseoutput.description: The signal sent when none of the inputs have received a non-zero signal (if empty, no signal is sent).
infotexts.sp.xorcomponent.timeframe.description: The item sends the output if one (and only one) of the inputs has received a non-zero signal within the timeframe.
infotexts.sp.xorcomponent.output.description: The signal sent when one (and only one) of the inputs has received a non-zero signal.
infotexts.sp.xorcomponent.falseoutput.description: The signal sent when none or both of the inputs have received a non-zero signal (if empty, no signal is sent).
infotexts.sp.arithmeticcomponent.timeframe.descrip: The item must have received signals to both inputs within this timeframe to output the result. If set to 0, the inputs must be received at the same time.
infotexts.equalscomponent.timeframe.description: The item must have received signals to both inputs within this timeframe to output the result. If set to 0, the inputs must be received at the same time.
infotexts.equalscomponent.output.description: The signal this item outputs when the inputs are equal.
infotexts.equalscomponent.falseoutput.description: The signal this item outputs when the inputs are not equal.
infotexts.greatercomponent.output.description: The signal this item outputs when the first input is greater than the second.
infotexts.greatercomponent.falseoutput.description: The signal this item outputs when the first input is not greater than the second.
infotexts.sp.signalcheckcomponent.output.name: Output
infotexts.sp.signalcheckcomponent.output.descripti: The signal this item outputs when the received signal matches the target signal.
infotexts.sp.signalcheckcomponent.falseoutput.name: False Output
infotexts.sp.signalcheckcomponent.falseoutput.desc: The signal this item outputs when the received signal does not match the target signal.
infotexts.sp.signalcheckcomponent.targetsignal.des: The value to compare the received signals against.
infotexts.sp.relaycomponent.maxpower.name: Max Power
infotexts.sp.relaycomponent.maxpower.description: The maximum amount of power that can pass through the item.
infotexts.sp.relaycomponent.ison.name: Is On
infotexts.sp.relaycomponent.ison.description: Can the relay currently pass power and signals through it.
infotexts.sp.relaycomponent.canbeoverloaded.name: Can Be Overloaded
infotexts.sp.relaycomponent.canbeoverloaded.descri: Can the item be damaged if too much power is supplied to the power grid.
infotexts.sp.relaycomponent.overloadvoltage.name: Overload Voltage
infotexts.sp.relaycomponent.overloadvoltage.descri: How much power has to be supplied to the grid relative to the load before item starts taking damage. E.g. a value of 2 means that the grid has to be receiving twice as much power as the devices in the grid are consuming.
infotexts.sp.relaycomponent.fireprobability.name: Fire Probability
infotexts.sp.relaycomponent.fireprobability.descri: The probability for a fire to start when the item breaks.
infotexts.sp.oscillatorcomponent.outputtype.name: Output Type
infotexts.sp.oscillatorcomponent.outputtype.descri: What kind of a signal the item outputs. Pulse: periodically sends out a signal of 1. Sine: sends out a sine wave oscillating between -1 and 1. Square: sends out a signal that alternates between 0 and 1.
infotexts.sp.oscillatorcomponent.frequency.name: Frequency
infotexts.sp.oscillatorcomponent.frequency.descrip: How fast the signal oscillates, or how fast the pulses are sent (in Hz).
infotexts.sp.lightcomponent.lightcolor.name: Light Color
infotexts.sp.lightcomponent.lightcolor.description: The color of the emitted light (R,G,B,A).
infotexts.sp.turret.hudtint.name: Hud Tint
infotexts.sp.turret.hudtint.description: Optional screen tint color when the item is being operated (R,G,B,A).
infotexts.sp.turret.reload.name: Reload
infotexts.sp.turret.reload.description: The period of time the user has to wait between shots.
infotexts.sp.turret.rotationlimits.name: Rotation Limits
infotexts.sp.turret.rotationlimits.description: The range at which the barrel can rotate. TODO
infotexts.sp.turret.springstiffnesslowskill.name: Spring Stiffness Low Skill
infotexts.sp.turret.springstiffnesslowskill.descri: How much torque is applied to rotate the barrel when the item is used by a character with insufficient skills to operate it. Higher values make the barrel rotate faster.
infotexts.sp.turret.springstiffnesshighskill.name: Spring Stiffness High Skill
infotexts.sp.turret.springstiffnesshighskill.descr: How much torque is applied to rotate the barrel when the item is used by a character with sufficient skills to operate it. Higher values make the barrel rotate faster.
infotexts.sp.turret.springdampinglowskill.name: Spring Damping Low Skill
infotexts.sp.turret.springdampinglowskill.descript: How much torque is applied to resist the movement of the barrel when the item is used by a character with insufficient skills to operate it. Higher values make the aiming more snappy, stopping the barrel from swinging around the direction it's being aimed at.
infotexts.sp.turret.springdampinghighskill.name: Spring Damping High Skill
infotexts.sp.turret.springdampinghighskill.descrip: How much torque is applied to resist the movement of the barrel when the item is used by a character with sufficient skills to operate it. Higher values make the aiming more snappy, stopping the barrel from swinging around the direction it's being aimed at.
infotexts.sp.turret.rotationspeedlowskill.name: Rotation Speed Low Skill
infotexts.sp.turret.rotationspeedlowskill.descript: Maximum angular velocity of the barrel when used by a character with insufficient skills to operate it.
infotexts.sp.turret.rotationspeedhighskill.name: Rotation Speed High Skill
infotexts.sp.turret.rotationspeedhighskill.descrip: Maximum angular velocity of the barrel when used by a character with sufficient skills to operate it.
infotexts.sp.turret.baserotation.name: Base Rotation
infotexts.sp.turret.baserotation.description: The angle of the turret's base in degrees.
infotexts.sp.motionsensor.onlyhumans.name: Only Humans
infotexts.sp.motionsensor.onlyhumans.description: Should the sensor only detect the movement of humans?
infotexts.sp.motionsensor.ignoredead.name: Ignore Dead
infotexts.sp.motionsensor.ignoredead.description: Should the sensor ignore the bodies of dead characters?
infotexts.sp.motionsensor.rangex.name: Range X
infotexts.sp.motionsensor.rangey.name: Range Y
infotexts.sp.motionsensor.detectoffset.name: Detect Offset
infotexts.sp.motionsensor.detectoffset.description: The position to detect the movement at relative to the item. For example, 0,100 would detect movement 100 units above the item.
infotexts.sp.motionsensor.output.name: Output
infotexts.sp.motionsensor.output.description: The signal the item outputs when it has detected movement.
infotexts.sp.motionsensor.falseoutput.name: False Output
infotexts.sp.motionsensor.falseoutput.description: The signal the item outputs when it has not detected movement.
infotexts.sp.motionsensor.minimumvelocity.name: Minimum Velocity
infotexts.sp.motionsensor.minimumvelocity.descript: How fast the objects within the detector's range have to be moving (in m/s).
infotexts.sp.waterdetector.output.name: Output
infotexts.sp.waterdetector.output.description: The signal the item sends out when it's underwater.
infotexts.sp.waterdetector.falseoutput.name: False Output
infotexts.sp.waterdetector.falseoutput.description: The signal the item sends out when it's not underwater.
infotexts.sp.electricaldischarger.range.name: Range
infotexts.sp.electricaldischarger.range.descriptio: How far the discharge can travel from the item.
infotexts.sp.electricaldischarger.rangemultiplieri: How much further can the discharge be carried when moving across walls.
infotexts.sp.electricaldischarger.duration.name: Duration
infotexts.sp.electricaldischarger.duration.descrip: The duration of an individual discharge (in seconds).
infotexts.sp.electricaldischarger.outdoorsonly.des: If set to true, the discharge cannot travel inside the submarine nor shock anyone inside.
infotexts.sp.powertransfer.canbeoverloaded.name: Can Be Overloaded
infotexts.sp.powertransfer.canbeoverloaded.descrip: Can the item be damaged if too much power is supplied to the power grid.
infotexts.sp.powertransfer.overloadvoltage.name: Overload Voltage
infotexts.sp.powertransfer.overloadvoltage.descrip: How much power has to be supplied to the grid relative to the load before item starts taking damage. E.g. a value of 2 means that the grid has to be receiving twice as much power as the devices in the grid are consuming.
infotexts.sp.powertransfer.fireprobability.name: Fire Probability
infotexts.sp.powertransfer.fireprobability.descrip: The probability for a fire to start when the item breaks.
infotexts.sp.throwable.holdpos.name: Hold Pos
infotexts.sp.throwable.holdpos.description: The position the character holds the item at (in pixels, as an offset from the character's shoulder). For example, a value of 10,-100 would make the character hold the item 100 pixels below the shoulder and 10 pixels forwards.
infotexts.sp.throwable.holdangle.name: Hold Angle
infotexts.sp.throwable.holdangle.description: The rotation at which the character holds the item (in degrees, relative to the rotation of the character's hand).
infotexts.sp.throwable.swingamount.name: Swing Amount
infotexts.sp.throwable.swingamount.description: How much the item swings around when aiming/holding it (in pixels, as an offset from AimPos/HoldPos).
infotexts.sp.throwable.swingspeed.name: Swing Speed
infotexts.sp.throwable.swingspeed.description: How fast the item swings around when aiming/holding it (only valid if SwingAmount is set).
infotexts.sp.throwable.swingwhenholding.name: Swing When Holding
infotexts.sp.throwable.swingwhenholding.descriptio: Should the item swing around when it's being held.
infotexts.sp.throwable.swingwhenaiming.name: Swing When Aiming
infotexts.sp.throwable.swingwhenaiming.description: Should the item swing around when it's being aimed.
infotexts.sp.throwable.swingwhenusing.name: Swing When Using
infotexts.sp.throwable.swingwhenusing.description: Should the item swing around when it's being used (for example, when firing a weapon or a welding tool).
infotexts.sp.propulsion.force.name: Force
infotexts.sp.propulsion.force.description: The force to apply to the user's body.
infotexts.sp.terminal.welcomemessage.name: Welcome Message
infotexts.sp.terminal.welcomemessage.description: The message to be displayed when opened.
infotexts.sp.pickingtime.name: Picking Time
infotexts.sp.pickingtime.description: How long it takes to pick up the item (in seconds).
infotexts.sp.canbepicked.name: Can Be Picked
infotexts.sp.canbepicked.description: Can the item be picked up (or interacted with, if the pick action does something else than picking up the item).
infotexts.sp.allowingameediting.name: Allow In Game Editing
infotexts.sp.allowingameediting.description: Can the properties of the component be edited in-game (only applicable if the component has in-game editable properties).
infotexts.sp.msg.name: Msg
infotexts.sp.msg.description: A text displayed next to the item when it's highlighted (generally instructs how to interact with the item, e.g. [Mouse1] Pick up).
infotexts.sp.minvoltage.name: Min Voltage
infotexts.sp.minvoltage.description: The minimum voltage required for the device to function. The voltage is calculated as power / powerconsumption, meaning that a device with a power consumption of 1000 kW would need at least 500 kW of power to work if the minimum voltage is set to 0.5.
infotexts.sp.powerconsumption.name: Power Consumption
infotexts.sp.powerconsumption.description: How much power the device draws (or attempts to draw) from the electrical grid when active.
infotexts.sp.vulnerabletoemp.name: Vulnerable To E M P
infotexts.sp.vulnerabletoemp.description: Can the item be damaged by electomagnetic pulses.
infotexts.subeditor.shadowcastinglightswarning: The submarine includes a very high number of shadow-casting lights, which can cause performance issues. You may want to go through the light sources and disable shadow casting where possible: dim and/or low-range static lights don't necessarily need to cast shadows if letting the light go through walls and doors is not noticeable, and lights outside the submarine can be set to be drawn behind the submarine so shadows don't need to be cast.
infotexts.subeditorvisibilitytooltip: Choose which types of entities are visible.
infotexts.gapinsidehullwarning: This gap will do nothing, because both sides of the gap are inside the same hull. If you want water and oxygen to flow through the gap, or a door to block water/oxygen flow, it must be placed between two hulls.
infotexts.generatewaypointsverification: Are you sure you want to regenerate the waypoints in the submarine? This will reset all the existing waypoints. To ensure that AI characters can navigate the submarine effectively, you may need to make some manual adjustments to the waypoints after they have been generated, such as adding extra waypoints and links between them to make sure the paths between the waypoints cover all rooms.
infotexts.nohumanspawnpointwarning: The submarine does not have spawnpoints for humans, meaning the crew will not be able to spawn correctly. To fix this, create a new spawnpoint and change its "spawn type" parameter to "human."

infotexts.toofarfromoutpostwarning: To whoever's out there swimming below the outpost, please head back immediately. It's not safe out there.

Hey! You there, below the outpost—what the hell do you think you're doing? I saw you on the sonar and thought you were a crawler for a second! Get back here before someone with an itchier trigger finger gets you killed.
To the diver below the outpost: Head back immediately. You're almost out of sonar range, and I really don't want to send a rescue team to save your ass when you get yourself lost.

infotexts.servertagdescription.casual: Having fun is more important than completing the objective. A good choice for new players.
infotexts.servertagdescription.serious: The crew should focus on working together efficiently and completing their objective. No unnecessary messing around.
infotexts.servertagdescription.roleplay: The crew should aim to act like a real submarine crew. Chain of command is important, as is taking care of your responsibilities and following orders. Speaking out-of-character should be avoided when a round is running.
infotexts.servertagdescription.somethingdifferent: Gameplay differs significantly from the usual Barotrauma gameplay. Modded servers, very unconventional subs, battle royale rounds, shuttle racing, deathrun maps... Anything goes!
infotexts.servertagdescription.rampage: Get ready to fight for your life! A server heavily geared toward combat. This can mean player-versus-player combat, PvE or both—the server description should include guidelines as to what kind of violence is allowed on the server.
infotexts.servertagdescription.modded.true: One or more mods enabled. Installing mods from the Workshop may be required to join the server.
infotexts.servertagdescription.modded.false: The server is not using any mods.
infotexts.servertagdescription.friendlyfire.true: Causing damage to your crew mates is enabled.
infotexts.servertagdescription.friendlyfire.false: Causing damage to your crew mates is disabled.
infotexts.servertagdescription.traitors.true: Traitors are enabled on the server.
infotexts.servertagdescription.traitors.false: Traitors are disabled on the server.
