infotexts.eventtext.bigbrother.c1.c1.o1.o1.c2: “You look like you've never done an honest day's work in your life.” They start inspecting undersides of the bunks. Now would be a good time to vanish before they get any wiser. This mission is a failure.
infotexts.eventtext.bigbrother.c1.c1.o1.o1.c2.c2: The guard draws their weapon. “Microphones, huh? You need to come with me.” Now would be a REALLY good time to run.
infotexts.eventtext.bigbrother.c1.c1.o1.o2.c1: The guard lets out a brief chuckle. “A funny guy. You shouldn't be here. Go on, git.” The guard then turns their attention to the cameras. Now would be a good time to vanish before they get any wiser. This mission is a failure.
infotexts.eventtext.bigbrother.c1.c1.o1.o2.c1.c1: The guard draws their weapon. “Microphones, huh? You need to come with me.” Now would be a REALLY good time to run.
infotexts.eventtext.bigbrother.c1.c1.o2.c1: You open up a nearby transistor radio and install a microphone inside the speaker, out of sight. Return to the chief to receive your payment.
infotexts.eventtext.bigbrother.c1.c1.o2.c1.c1: “Good work. Here's your payment. We never spoke.”
infotexts.eventtext.bigbrother.c1.c1.o2.c2: You spot a transistor radio that could possibly hold a microphone. As you're fiddling with it, a security guard calls out. “You! Come here!” You decide to comply for now. “What were you doing?” the guard demands.
infotexts.eventtext.bigbrother.c1.c1.o2.o1.c1: “Finally. Make sure K-Rawler comes through loud and clear.” Something will come through all right, you think to yourself. Return to the chief to receive your payment.
infotexts.eventtext.bigbrother.c1.c1.o2.o1.c1.c1: “Good work. Here's your payment. We never spoke.”
infotexts.eventtext.bigbrother.c1.c1.o2.o2.c1: The guard lets out a brief chuckle. “A funny guy. You shouldn't be here. Go on, git.” The guard then turns their attention to the cameras. Now would be a good time to vanish before they get any wiser. This mission is a failure.
infotexts.eventtext.bigbrother.c1.c1.o2.o2.c1.c1: The guard draws their weapon. “Microphones, huh? You need to come with me.” Now would be a REALLY good time to run.
infotexts.eventtext.tastetest.c1: In a nearby trash can, there are two small bottles of clear liquid. Both of them are labeled with a different chemical formula.
infotexts.eventtext.tastetest.o1: Take a closer look at the bottles.
infotexts.eventtext.tastetest.o1.c1: Neither solution is anything you’re especially familiar with, but you are reasonably sure one of them is strongly acidic. You decide to leave the acid be. The other bottle is a total mystery to you.
infotexts.eventtext.tastetest.o1.o1.c1: The solution has a slightly mellow and sweet quality to it and it leaves a lingering aftertaste of apricot. It seems to have no other effects. You decide to leave the bottles in the trash and continue on.
infotexts.eventtext.tastetest.o1.o1.o1.c1: After a while, you realize drinking the solution has made all your pains disappear. For the first time in forever, you feel good. You don't know what the solution is but you wish you had some more. Maybe there's some more in the trash?
infotexts.eventtext.tastetest.o1.o1.o1.o1: Maybe I should take another look in there.
infotexts.eventtext.tastetest.o1.o1.o1.o1.c1: You return to the trash can and find a couple more bottles. None of them are the same as the one you drank but maybe they can be of some other use.
infotexts.eventtext.tastetest.o1.o2: Not a very sensible thing to do...
infotexts.eventtext.tastetest.o1.c2: Chemistry makes no sense to you; it might as well be an alien language. After a quick shake test, either liquid seems perfectly safe to you. One of them has a blue label, the other green. Do you want to try one of them?
infotexts.eventtext.tastetest.o1.o3.c1: The solution has a slightly mellow and sweet quality to it and it leaves a lingering aftertaste of apricot. It seems to have no other effects. You decide to leave the bottles in the trash and continue on.
infotexts.eventtext.tastetest.o1.o3.o1.c1: After a while, you realize drinking the solution has made all your pains disappear. For the first time in forever, you feel good. You don't know what the solution is but you wish you had some more. Maybe there's some more in the trash?
infotexts.eventtext.tastetest.o1.o3.o1.o1: Maybe I should take another look in there.
infotexts.eventtext.tastetest.o1.o3.o1.o1.c1: You return to the trash can and find a couple more bottles. Maybe one of these is the same miracle solution!
infotexts.eventtext.tastetest.o1.o4.c1: The liquid burns your throat a bit when you swallow it. At first, the effect isn’t unlike a good Jovian vodka, and the prospect of getting buzzed while spending no money appeals to you greatly. The situation suddenly takes a turn for the worse when you feel like your stomach is on fire. A sharp pain causes you to double over in agony. Who would’ve thought drinking something out of the trash was a bad idea?
infotexts.eventtext.crawleroutbreak.c1: A panicked researcher runs past you. “God dammit Jimmy, I told you we should’ve went with padlocks instead of these electronic pieces of shit!”
infotexts.eventtext.consultant.c1: As you step inside the office, the manager notices you. “I suppose you're here about the situation in the mines?” he asks.
infotexts.eventtext.consultant.o1: “Uh...sure. Remind me what the situation was, again?”
infotexts.eventtext.consultant.o1.c1: It turns out the miners have halted the work in the mines because of a toxic gas leak. “They're demanding ridiculous hazard pay and we just don't have the budget for that. That's why you're here, right? To negotiate a better deal?”
infotexts.eventtext.consultant.o1.o1: “Yes, that's right. Get me in contact with the foreman.”
infotexts.eventtext.consultant.o1.o1.c1: “They can probably be found near the main mineshaft. Good luck.”
infotexts.eventtext.consultant.o1.o1.c1.c1: The foreman is pacing back and forth, loudly arguing with someone on the radio. You only catch the tail end of their discussion. “There aren't enough diving masks for the whole crew. Even if there were, we couldn't waste the oxygen keeping them on all day long. ...No, the ventilation in the mines is connected to the rest of the outpost so we can't risk pumping it out either.” Exasperated, he looks at you. “Are you here about the gas leaks?”
infotexts.eventtext.consultant.o1.o1.c1.o1: Haggle for lower hazard pay for miners.
infotexts.eventtext.consultant.o1.o1.c1.o1.c1: You successfully explain that not everyone can be paid extra for hazardous work. This will probably result in most of the crew walking out and the rest having to work their asses off, but at least you got paid a hefty consultant fee.
infotexts.eventtext.consultant.o1.o1.c1.o1.c2: The foreman stands their ground. No hazard pay, no digging. At least you tried.
infotexts.eventtext.consultant.o1.o1.c1.o2: “What kind of gases are we talking about?”
infotexts.eventtext.consultant.o1.o1.c1.o2.c1: “Mercury gases. Colorless, odorless, gives you breathing problems real quick.”
infotexts.eventtext.consultant.o1.o1.c1.o2.o1: Come up with a solution to help with mercury exposure.
infotexts.eventtext.consultant.o1.o1.c1.o2.o1.c1: “A combination of iron, Stabilozine and crawler liver should keep your lungs clean of mercury. Take two pills every six hours.” The foreman thanks you for your advice. You collect a considerable reward from the outpost manager.
infotexts.eventtext.consultant.o1.o1.c1.o2.o1.c2: You can't come up with anything that could help the situation.
infotexts.eventtext.consultant.o1.o1.c1.o2.o2: Haggle for lower hazard pay for miners.
infotexts.eventtext.consultant.o1.o1.c1.o2.o2.c1: You successfully explain that not everyone can be paid extra for hazardous work. This will probably result in most of the crew walking out and the rest having to work their asses off, but at least you got paid a hefty consultant fee.
infotexts.eventtext.consultant.o1.o1.c1.o2.o2.c2: The foreman stands their ground. No hazard pay, no digging. At least you tried.
infotexts.eventtext.consultant.o1.o1.c1.o3: “Tell me more about the ventilation problem.”
infotexts.eventtext.consultant.o1.o1.c1.o3.c1: “The ducts reach from here all the way to the mess hall and dorms, meaning we can't pump the vapors out. I don't know who installed them originally, but I'd like to have a word with 'em.”
infotexts.eventtext.consultant.o1.o1.c1.o3.o1: Attempt to solve the ventilation problem.
infotexts.eventtext.consultant.o1.o1.c1.o3.o1.c1: You study a map of ventilation ducts. “Why not install an extra air filtration system right here?” you suggest, pointing to a junction near the dorms. “Should pump out all the mercury before it spreads farther.” And sure enough, it does. You collect a fee from the manager for solving the problem.
infotexts.eventtext.consultant.o1.o1.c1.o3.o1.c2: You can't come up with anything that could help the situation.
infotexts.eventtext.consultant.o1.o1.c1.o3.o2: Haggle for lower hazard pay for miners.
infotexts.eventtext.consultant.o1.o1.c1.o3.o2.c1: You successfully explain that not everyone can be paid extra for hazardous work. This will probably result in most of the crew walking out and the rest having to work their asses off, but at least you got paid a hefty consultant fee.
infotexts.eventtext.consultant.o1.o1.c1.o3.o2.c2: The foreman stands their ground. No hazard pay, no digging. At least you tried.
infotexts.eventtext.consultant.o1.o2: “This is above my pay grade. Goodbye.”
infotexts.eventtext.huskcultist_return.c1: “Do you have the eggs with you now?”
infotexts.eventtext.huskcultist_return.o1.c1: You check your pockets. As luck would have it, you have some husk eggs on you.
infotexts.eventtext.huskcultist_return.o1.o1.c1: You exchange the eggs for money, which you count immediately. It's all there.
infotexts.eventtext.huskcultist_return.o1.o2.c1: You decide to donate the eggs for free. The person seems overjoyed.
infotexts.eventtext.huskcultist_return.o1.o3: Actually, I'll keep these for now.
infotexts.eventtext.huskcultist_return.o1.c2: “No, you don't. Please stop wasting my time.”
infotexts.eventtext.missionevent_collectminerals.c: “There's been talk of valuable mineral clusters nearby. We'd like you to see if there's any truth to the rumors.”
infotexts.eventtext.missionevent_mudraptornest.c1: “A couple of divers stumbled upon a mudraptor nest full of eggs in a nearby cave. We obviously don't want a swarm of raptors in our backyard, so if you can get rid of those eggs we'd happily pay you.”
infotexts.eventtext.missionevent_crawlernest.c1: “A couple of divers discovered a bunch of crawler eggs in a nearby cave. We don't need any more crawlers near the station, so I've put a little reward aside for the crew that wipes out the nest.”
infotexts.eventtext.missionevent_tigerthreshernest: “A couple of divers discovered a thresher nest full of eggs in a nearby cave. We don't want to see those things hatching, and there's a reward in it for any crew that makes sure they won't.”
infotexts.eventtext.missionevent_beacon.c1: “We could use a hand getting one of our beacon stations back online and transmitting so we can start building a new outpost out there. There's some marks in it for you and your crew if you can set it right.”
infotexts.upgradedescription.increasewallhealth: Increase submarine hull durability. Makes the walls less vulnerable to damage and allows the submarine to dive deeper without getting crushed by pressure.
infotexts.upgradedescription.increasedeterioration: Equipment will take longer to start deteriorating.
infotexts.upgradedescription.decreaselowskillfixdu: Decrease the amount of time needed to repair equipment when unskilled.
infotexts.upgradedescription.decreaserequiredskill: Decrease the skill level required to repair items.
infotexts.upgradedescription.increasefabricationsp: Decrease the time needed to fabricate items.
infotexts.upgradedescription.decreasefabricationsk: Lower the skill levels required for item fabrication.
infotexts.upgradedescription.turretincreaserotatio: Increase the rotation rate of all guns when operated by insufficiently skilled crew.
infotexts.upgradedescription.turretincreaseoffseto: Increase the view range of all weapons.
infotexts.upgradedescription.increaseoxygengenerat: Increase the amount of oxygen generated.
infotexts.upgradedescription.increasemeltdowndelay: Increase the time reactors can stay at critical temperature before meltdown.
infotexts.upgradedescription.increasemaxpumpflow: Increase the speed at which water is pumped in or out of the sub.
infotexts.upgradedescription.decreasefireprobabili: Decrease the probability of fires occurring.
infotexts.upgradeui.title: Shipyard
infotexts.upgrades.purchasepromptbody: Do you want to purchase "[upgradename]" for [amount] marks?
infotexts.itemrepairs.purchasepromptbody: Do you want to repair all items on the submarine for [amount] marks?
infotexts.wallrepairs.purchasepromptbody: Do you want to repair all hulls on the submarine for [amount] marks?
infotexts.replacelostshuttles.purchasepromptbody: Do you want to replace lost shuttles for [amount] marks?
infotexts.upgraderefundbody: Your pending upgrades have been refunded.
infotexts.suppliespurchasedmessage: The purchased supplies will be delivered to your submarine when you leave [location].
infotexts.campaignstore.sellwarningtext: Are you sure you want to sell the items?
infotexts.campaingstore.valueincreasetooltip: Buying the listed items will increase the merchant's balance enough for them to offer more for items sold in the future!
infotexts.campaingstore.valuedecreasetooltip: Selling the listed items will decrease the merchant's balance enough for them to offer less for items sold in the future.
infotexts.crewhiredmessage: The newly hired personnel will join the crew when you leave [location].
infotexts.purchaseandswitchsubmarinetext: Purchase [submarinename1] for [amount] [currencyname] and switch to it from your current submarine ([submarinename2])?
infotexts.deliveryrequesttext: Deliver [submarinename1] from the nearest colony at [location1] to your location at [location2] and switch to it from your current submarine ([submarinename2]) for [amount] [currencyname]?
infotexts.notenoughmoneyfordeliverytext: Not enough [currencyname] to deliver [submarinename] from the nearest colony at [location1] to your location at [location2]!
infotexts.switchsubmarinetext: Switch from your current submarine [submarinename1] to [submarinename2]?
infotexts.submarinepurchaseandswitchvote: [playername] wants to purchase [submarinename] for [amount] [currencyname] and switch to it from the current submarine.
infotexts.submarineswitchfeevote: [playername] wants to switch from the current submarine to [submarinename] with a delivery from [locationname] costing [amount] [currencyname].
infotexts.submarineswitchnofeevote: [playername] wants to switch from the current submarine to [submarinename].
infotexts.submarinepurchaseandswitchvotepassed: The crew agreed to purchase and switch to [submarinename] for [amount] [currencyname], with [yesvotecount] votes for and [novotecount] against.
infotexts.submarinepurchasevotepassed: The crew agreed to purchase [submarinename] for [amount] [currencyname], with [yesvotecount] votes for and [novotecount] against.

infotexts.faction.coalition.description: The autocratic de facto superpower of Europa, with a distributed bureaucracy and an iron grip on the resources, manufacturing and power within Europan society. They rule by fear, and have a reputation for shutting disobedient colonies and outposts out of the supply loop, or simply subjugating them by direct force. Their motivation is ultimately to preserve humanity, but at any cost, and preferably with the status quo left intact.
infotexts.faction.coalition.shortdescription: The autocratic de facto superpower of Europa, with a distributed bureaucracy and an iron grip on the resources, manufacturing and power within Europan society.
infotexts.faction.clowns.description: Every once in a while, these minstrels, fools and clowns attempt to form unions, and names like "Europan Jesters' Association" pop up. In truth, the Honkmother's children are a less-than-organized lot who simply heed the call of the bikehorn.
infotexts.faction.clowns.shortdescription: The Honkmother's children are an unorganized lot who simply heed the call of the bikehorn.
infotexts.faction.separatists.description: A small, underground organization seeking a more democratic society by any means, from petty resistance to full-blown terrorism, all with the end goal of disrupting the ability of the Europa Coalition to function, and to undermine its authority.
infotexts.faction.separatists.shortdescription: A small, underground organization seeking a more democratic society by any means, from petty resistance to full-blown terrorism.
infotexts.faction.huskcult.description: A mysterious and outlawed religious group with a transhumanist twist, they seek 'communion' with the husk parasite in order to usher in a new kind of humanity, one more capable of surviving in this harsh environment, more in tune with the local ecosystem, and devoid of pride, hatred, fear, or complex thought. Hated equally by the Europa Coalition and the Jovian separatists.
infotexts.faction.huskcult.shortdescription: A religious group that seeks 'communion' with the husk parasite in order to usher in a new kind of humanity, one more capable of surviving in this harsh environment.
infotexts.toofarfromoutpostwarning: To whoever's out there swimming below the outpost, please head back immediately. It's not safe out there.

Hey! You there, below the outpost—what the hell do you think you're doing? I saw you on the sonar and thought you were a crawler for a second! Get back here before someone with an itchier trigger finger gets you killed.
To the diver below the outpost: Head back immediately. You're almost out of sonar range, and I really don't want to send a rescue team to save your ass when you get yourself lost.
infotexts.campaignend1: Hints of what are to come flash before your eyes: a crystalline space, something coiled within itself slumbering fitfully. But you are not yet ready to fully experience this. Your fate is still being woven by the Undertow.
infotexts.campaignend2: Outside the ordered universe lies that amorphous blight of nethermost confusion which blasphemes and bubbles at the center of all infinity—the boundless daemon sultan Azathoth, whose name no lips dare speak aloud, and who gnaws hungrily in inconceivable, unlighted chambers beyond time and space amidst the muffled, maddening beating of vile drums and the thin, monotonous whine of accursed flutes. - Howard Phillips Lovecraft
infotexts.campaignend3: You've reached the edge of the unknown. Beyond here a true conclusion takes shape, but is not for your eyes yet. Return again when the time is right.
infotexts.campaignend4: Everything fades to black in this moment... You've just been commissioned by the Europa Coalition at xxxx to serve aboard a yyyy class sub. The waters of Europa open up before you, ever deadlier. A sense of déjà vu overcomes you—have you done this all before?
infotexts.campaignend5: Having reached the end, your adventure restarts from a new beginning, this time with greater peril in store for you.
infotexts.shrinkingmap: As the intensity of the Jovian radiation effect increases, shallower regions of Europa will gradually become uninhabitable and unsafe to travel. Make your way to deeper waters to avoid it.
infotexts.outpostmodulemaxcounttooltip: How many instances of this module can be used in the same outpost.
infotexts.outpostmoduletooltip: Outposts are generated from a combination of outpost modules. If you want your custom modules to be used in outpost generation, you must add them to a content package (i.e. your mod) after saving.

infotexts.campaignstart:
In the late 20th century, it was discovered that under the icy, irradiated surface of Jupiter's moon Europa lies a vast sea capable of sustaining life. This discovery sent shockwaves through the scientific community.

In the year 2022, the first manned space flight arrived on Europa to discover that the moon was indeed already sustaining life, in the form of hostile sub-aquatic fauna. Besides the wildlife, the researchers faced gruelling difficulties posed by the dangerous radiation emitted from Jupiter and the intense cold and tremendous pressure of the Europan ocean.

Despite all their hardships, Earth-born colonists were able to construct a handful of habitable outposts where a new way of life developed over many decades. A new system of governance was formed by a coalition of the largest, most influential cities on the moon. Different industries made their mark in the new world, including mining, manufacturing and chemical laboratories.

Over the years, Europan society became more and more dissociated from Earth. Fifty years ago, contact was lost entirely, and no more supply ships have arrived since.

Sub-aquatic travel and vehicles are in a key role in this new society, scouting for new inhabitable locations, protecting citizens from creature attacks and establishing supply lines between stations as humanity ventures ever deeper to evade the lethal radiation from Jupiter above. The life of a crewmember aboard one of these submarines is a lucrative one, albeit dangerous and often short.

You have enlisted to serve on a yyyy-class submarine, docked at xxxx. The waters of Europa open up before you—explore, help expand the colonies, and make of this place what you will.
infotexts.dialogcantfindtoxygen: I can't find any oxygen tanks!
infotexts.dialoglowonweldingfuel: There's not many welding fuel tanks left aboard the sub!
infotexts.dialoglowonoxygentanks: Almost all the oxygen tanks on the sub are empty! Can we get some of the empty tanks to the oxygen generator for rechaging?
infotexts.dialoglowoncoilgunammo: We're running low on coilgun ammunition! Fire short controlled bursts!
infotexts.dialoglowonrailgunammo: There's not many railgun shells left onboard.
infotexts.dialoglowonturretammo: We're running low on ammunition. We should get some more at the next stop.
infotexts.dialoglowonfuelrods: We're very low on fuel rods. We should buy more ASAP, or make some.
infotexts.dialogoutofoxygentanks: All our oxygen tanks are empty!
infotexts.dialogoutofrailgunammo: There are no more shells for the railgun!
infotexts.dialogoutoffuelrods: We're completely out of fuel rods!
infotexts.campaignoption.enableradiation.tooltip: The radiation belts around Jupiter are slowly becoming more intense, forcing Europans to delve deeper below the moon's icy crust. In practice, this feature slowly pushes you towards the more dangerous areas of the game, ensuring a gradual increase in difficulty.
infotexts.radiationtooltip: LETHAL RADIATION\nThe intensity of Jovian radiation has reached lethal levels in this area. Travelling inside the area is strongly díscouraged.
infotexts.nomissionprompt: There are missions available, but you haven't selected any. Are you sure you want to depart without a mission?
infotexts.entitydescription.rustdecal: Decorative decal for walls and machines
infotexts.missiondescription.abandonedoutposthuman: Contact with [location1] was recently lost, and it's suspected to have been taken over by someone. Destroy the outpost's reactor to drive away any squatters and ensure they don't return.
infotexts.missionsuccess.abandonedoutposthumans: The squatters were driven away from the outpost successfully.
infotexts.missionmessage0.abandonedoutposthumans: The reactor has been destroyed. This should make sure squatters won't try to take over the outpost again. Undock from the outpost to complete the mission.
infotexts.missiondescription.abandonedoutpostmonst: Contact with [location1] was recently lost, and it's suspected that hostile fauna has built a nest inside it. Find any eggs inside the outpost and destroy them.
infotexts.missionsuccess.abandonedoutpostmonsters: The nest inside the outpost has been successfully destroyed.
infotexts.missionmessage0.abandonedoutpostmonsters: The nest inside the outpost has been successfully destroyed. Undock from the outpost to complete the mission.
infotexts.missiondescription.abandonedoutpostassas: Contact with [location1] was recently lost, and there have been reports about a notorious group of outlaws having claimed it as their base. There's a bounty on the head of the group's leader's – eliminate the leader to claim the reward.
infotexts.missionsuccess.abandonedoutpostassassina: The leader of the bandit group has been successfully eliminated.
infotexts.missionfailure.abandonedoutpostassassina: Eliminating the leader of the bandit group failed.
infotexts.missionmessage0.abandonedoutpostassassin: The leader of the bandit group has been successfully eliminated. Undock from the outpost to complete the mission.
infotexts.missiondescription.abandonedoutpostrescu: A bandit group that has claimed the abandoned [location1] recently sent out a message in which they demand a ransom for releasing a group of civilians they're holding hostage. The Coalition doesn't negotiate with terrorists, but has promised a considerable reward to anyone who manages to rescue the hostages.
infotexts.missionmessage0.abandonedoutpostrescue: The hostages are now all safely on board the sub. Undock from the outpost to complete the mission.
infotexts.hostageskilled: The mission has failed; one of the hostages has died.
infotexts.missiondescription.huntinggrounds: A creature from the Abyss has made this passageway its hunting grounds. Until the beast is dead, new outposts won't be established in the adjacent locations, and existing outposts may get abandoned.
infotexts.missionsuccess.huntinggrounds: The Abyss creature is now dead and the passageway safer to traverse.
infotexts.missionfailure.huntinggrounds: The Abyss creature remains a threat to nearby colonists.
infotexts.missionmessage0.huntinggrounds: The Abyss creature is now dead and the passageway safer to traverse.
infotexts.missiondescription.beaconnoreward: According to the onboard navigation system, there should be a run-down beacon station nearby. Getting it back online will make the passage easier for other vessels to traverse, and help colonies to spread further.
infotexts.missionmessage0.beaconnoreward: The beacon station is back online.
infotexts.beaconstationactivetooltip: There's an active ‖color:gui.orange‖beacon station‖end‖ in this passageway, which helps human habitation spread into nearby locations.
infotexts.beaconstationinactivetooltip: There's an inactive ‖color:gui.orange‖beacon station‖end‖ in this passageway. Getting it back online will make it easier for human habitation to spread into nearby locations.
infotexts.huntinggroundstooltip: A creature from the Abyss has made this passageway its ‖color:gui.orange‖hunting grounds‖end‖. Until the beast is dead, new outposts won't be established in the adjacent locations, and existing outposts may get abandoned.
infotexts.enteremptylocation: Select a destination and leave the passageway
infotexts.EventText.unlockpathgeneric.c1: “I've heard a lot about your crew's recent endeavours, and I must say the Coalition appreciates the work you're doing. Not every sub is allowed to pass through this outpost to the deeper regions, but you and your crew are more than welcome to pass.”
infotexts.EventText.unlockpathgeneric.c2: “Looking to pass through the outpost to the deeper regions? The Coalition won't grant a novice crew passage there, and judging by your reputation, you're definitely not someone I'd let pass. Of course if you happened to have 5000 marks to share with me, my opinion of you would almost certainly improve...”
infotexts.EventText.unlockpathgeneric.o1.c1: “On a second thought, you seem like someone with potential, so perhaps I'll let you pass after all. Pleasure doing business with you.”
infotexts.EventText.unlockpathgeneric.o2.c1: “Your choice. Maybe it's better for you to play in the kiddie pool a little longer anyway.”
infotexts.EventText.unlockpathgeneric.nomoney: “Not enough cash? Well, tough luck. Maybe you should play in the kiddie pool a little longer to prove us you have what it takes to make it out there.”
infotexts.pathunlockedgeneric: The passageway to the next biome has been opened.
infotexts.EventText.unlockpathcoldcaverns.c1: “You've certainly kept yourself busy in the Cold Caverns. I must say the Coalition appreciates the work you've put in. As you may be aware, this is the last stop before the Europan Ridge. Not every sub is allowed to pass through this outpost to the deeper regions, but you and your crew are more than welcome to pass.”
infotexts.EventText.unlockpathcoldcaverns.c2: “Looking to pass through the outpost to the deeper regions? The Coalition won't grant a novice crew passage there, and judging by your reputation, you're definitely not someone I'd let pass. Of course, if you happened to have some marks to share with me, my opinion of you would almost certainly improve.”
infotexts.EventText.unlockpathcoldcaverns.o1.c1: “On second thought, you seem like someone with potential. Perhaps I'll let you pass after all. Pleasure doing business with you.”
infotexts.EventText.unlockpathcoldcaverns.o2.c1: “Your choice. Maybe it's better for you to play in the kiddie pool a little longer anyway.”
infotexts.EventText.unlockpathcoldcaverns.o1.nomon: “Not enough cash? Well, tough luck. Maybe you should play in the kiddie pool a little longer to prove to us you have what it takes to make it out there.”
infotexts.EventText.unlockpatheuropanridge.c1: “It says here you've been helping the effort to colonize the Ridge. For that, we've decided to grant you access to the Aphotic Plateau. Bon voyage!”
infotexts.EventText.unlockpatheuropanridge.c2: “Looking to pass through to the Plateau? I don't know... I haven't seen much effort from your side to prove your loyalty to the cause. A donation would go a long way.”
infotexts.EventText.unlockpatheuropanridge.o1.c1: “Ah yes, that will work. You shall now pass.”
infotexts.EventText.unlockpatheuropanridge.o2.c1: “Oh? You're welcome to stay in the Europan Ridge for as long as you want, in that case.”
infotexts.EventText.unlockpatheuropanridge.o1.nomo: “I'm sorry. I can't accept anything less than twelve thousand marks. Maybe you should salvage a couple more wrecks. Or whatever it is you do.”
infotexts.EventText.unlockpathaphoticplateau.c1: “I'll have to congratulate you. Not many make it through the Plateau, much less while being so useful. I'll radio ahead to let you move to the Great Sea.”
infotexts.EventText.unlockpathaphoticplateau.c2: “I'm sorry, I know you've made it this far, but we can't take the risk to let an unknown crew to wander around the Great Sea. For your protection, you understand.”
infotexts.EventText.unlockpathaphoticplateau.o1.c1: “I'm sure it will. That is not an official guarantee by the Coalition nor an endorsement. I'll let the guard know you can take care of yourself.”
infotexts.EventText.unlockpathaphoticplateau.o2.c1: “I'm sure you'll find a nice duplex to live out your retirement. The radiation shouldn't reach here for a few days at least.”
infotexts.EventText.unlockpathaphoticplateau.o1.no: “Fifteen thousand will convince me. No less. Come back when you have it.”
infotexts.EventText.unlockpathgreatsea.c1: “So you want to enter the Hydrothermal Wastes? Why on Europa would you do such a thing? I suppose it's none of my business. A friend of the Coalition is a friend of mine. Go ahead.”
infotexts.EventText.unlockpathgreatsea.c2: “Do you have clearance to enter the Hydrothermal Wastes? Didn't think so. As luck would have it, we're having a clearance sale right now, if you know what I mean.”
infotexts.EventText.unlockpathgreatsea.o1: “19,000? What a steal! Here you go.”
infotexts.EventText.unlockpathgreatsea.o1.nomoney: “This isn't enough. I can't go below 19,000. Come back when you have it.”
